Aerial Modification.name: Aerial Modification
Aerial Modification.text:
Enchant creature or Vehicle
As long as enchanted permanent is a Vehicle, it's a creature in addition to its other types.
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying.

Aeronaut Admiral.flavor: The Consulate recruits its best pilots from the League of Aeronauts. Many go on to command entire fleets.
Aeronaut Admiral.name: Aeronaut Admiral
Aeronaut Admiral.text:
Flying
Vehicles you control have flying.

Aether Inspector.name: Aether Inspector
Aether Inspector.text:
Vigilance
When Aether Inspector enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Whenever Aether Inspector attacks, you may pay {E}{E}. If you do, create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.

Aethergeode Miner.flavor: Gremlins in the wild feed on nodules of pure aether, which are also prized by miners.
Aethergeode Miner.name: Aethergeode Miner
Aethergeode Miner.text:
Whenever Aethergeode Miner attacks, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Pay {E}{E}: Exile Aethergeode Miner, then return it to the battlefield under its owner's control.

Airdrop Aeronauts.name: Airdrop Aeronauts
Airdrop Aeronauts.text:
Flying
Revolt — When Airdrop Aeronauts enters the battlefield, if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, you gain 5 life.

Alley Evasion.flavor: "Sure, you know the law. But I know the streets."
Alley Evasion.name: Alley Evasion
Alley Evasion.text:
Choose one —
• Target creature you control gets +1/+2 until end of turn.
• Return target creature you control to its owner's hand.

Audacious Infiltrator.flavor: "This little critter can turn all of you to scrap in under thirty seconds! Come on, who wants to be the first to go? Try and stop me!"
Audacious Infiltrator.name: Audacious Infiltrator
Audacious Infiltrator.text: Audacious Infiltrator can't be blocked by artifact creatures.

Bastion Enforcer.flavor: Headquartered at the Bastion of the Honorable, the Consulate's enforcers are charged with the impossible task of keeping the peace.
Bastion Enforcer.name: Bastion Enforcer

Call for Unity.flavor: The "leaking spire" stands for liberation from Consulate control.
Call for Unity.name: Call for Unity
Call for Unity.text:
Revolt — At the beginning of your end step, if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, put a unity counter on Call for Unity.
Creatures you control get +1/+1 for each unity counter on Call for Unity.

Caught in the Brights.flavor: While hunting aether, a gremlin may ignore other stimuli, including threats to its own life.
Caught in the Brights.name: Caught in the Brights
Caught in the Brights.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
When a Vehicle you control attacks, exile enchanted creature.

Consulate Crackdown.flavor: "The workshops are silent. Our creations have been seized. They have killed what made us alive." —Pia Nalaar
Consulate Crackdown.name: Consulate Crackdown
Consulate Crackdown.text: When Consulate Crackdown enters the battlefield, exile all artifacts your opponents control until Consulate Crackdown leaves the battlefield.

Conviction.flavor: "There is no greater coward than one who believes in nothing."
Conviction.name: Conviction
Conviction.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+3.
{W}: Return Conviction to its owner's hand.

Countless Gears Renegade.flavor: "Go forth and cause trouble, my little one!"
Countless Gears Renegade.name: Countless Gears Renegade
Countless Gears Renegade.text: Revolt — When Countless Gears Renegade enters the battlefield, if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.

Dawnfeather Eagle.flavor: "It came to rest upon the angel's arm, and then the weight of their gazes fell upon me." —Aeronaut's journal
Dawnfeather Eagle.name: Dawnfeather Eagle
Dawnfeather Eagle.text:
Flying
When Dawnfeather Eagle enters the battlefield, creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain vigilance until end of turn.

Deadeye Harpooner.flavor: "It seems there's even better hunting down here."
Deadeye Harpooner.name: Deadeye Harpooner
Deadeye Harpooner.text: Revolt — When Deadeye Harpooner enters the battlefield, if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, destroy target tapped creature an opponent controls.

Decommission.flavor: "A key weakness in the design is its vulnerability to repeated, forceful blows."
Decommission.name: Decommission
Decommission.text:
Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
Revolt — If a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, you gain 3 life.

Deft Dismissal.flavor: "With spy thopters all around, how can the consuls be so blind to Tezzeret's manipulations?" —Gideon Jura
Deft Dismissal.name: Deft Dismissal
Deft Dismissal.text: Deft Dismissal deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three target attacking or blocking creatures.

Exquisite Archangel.flavor: A living invention born of a grand design.
Exquisite Archangel.name: Exquisite Archangel
Exquisite Archangel.text:
Flying
If you would lose the game, instead exile Exquisite Archangel and your life total becomes equal to your starting life total.

Felidar Guardian.flavor: The loyalty of a felidar is hard won but worth the effort.
Felidar Guardian.name: Felidar Guardian
Felidar Guardian.text: When Felidar Guardian enters the battlefield, you may exile another target permanent you control, then return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

Ghirapur Osprey.flavor: Many airship captains keep pets that share their love of the sky.
Ghirapur Osprey.name: Ghirapur Osprey

Restoration Specialist.flavor: Dwarves' tools are priceless heirlooms handed down through generations.
Restoration Specialist.name: Restoration Specialist
Restoration Specialist.text: {W}, Sacrifice Restoration Specialist: Return up to one target artifact card and up to one target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.

Solemn Recruit.flavor: "I can no longer sit in my workshop and ignore the events outside. My hammers strike for the people of Ghirapur."
Solemn Recruit.name: Solemn Recruit
Solemn Recruit.text:
Double strike
Revolt — At the beginning of your end step, if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, put a +1/+1 counter on Solemn Recruit.

Sram, Senior Edificer.flavor: "As this conflict grows, it gets harder to prevent the city from breaking down. How much longer can we keep this machinery balanced?"
Sram, Senior Edificer.name: Sram, Senior Edificer
Sram, Senior Edificer.text: Whenever you cast an Aura, Equipment, or Vehicle spell, draw a card.

Sram's Expertise.flavor: "It's important to always have the right tool for the job. This one is for picking my teeth."
Sram's Expertise.name: Sram's Expertise
Sram's Expertise.text:
Create three 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature tokens.
You may cast a card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your hand without paying its mana cost.

Thopter Arrest.name: Thopter Arrest
Thopter Arrest.text: When Thopter Arrest enters the battlefield, exile target artifact or creature an opponent controls until Thopter Arrest leaves the battlefield.

Aether Swooper.name: Aether Swooper
Aether Swooper.text:
Flying
When Aether Swooper enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Whenever Aether Swooper attacks, you may pay {E}{E}. If you do, create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.

Aethertide Whale.flavor: "To survive up here, I've learned when to use my harpoon and when to just enjoy the view." —Kadhu, skywhaler
Aethertide Whale.name: Aethertide Whale
Aethertide Whale.text:
Flying
When Aethertide Whale enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E} (six energy counters).
Pay {E}{E}{E}{E}: Return Aethertide Whale to its owner's hand.

Baral, Chief of Compliance.flavor: "The echo of silence is music to my ears."
Baral, Chief of Compliance.name: Baral, Chief of Compliance
Baral, Chief of Compliance.text:
Instant and sorcery spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Whenever a spell or ability you control counters a spell, you may draw a card. If you do, discard a card.

Baral's Expertise.name: Baral's Expertise
Baral's Expertise.text:
Return up to three target artifacts and/or creatures to their owners' hands.
You may cast a card with converted mana cost 4 or less from your hand without paying its mana cost.

Bastion Inventor.flavor: "This armor transcends the limitations of mere flesh and bone."
Bastion Inventor.name: Bastion Inventor
Bastion Inventor.text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

Disallow.flavor: "How easily your flames are quenched." —Baral, Chief of Compliance
Disallow.name: Disallow
Disallow.text: Counter target spell, activated ability, or triggered ability. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)

Dispersal Technician.flavor: As renegade forces closed in on the Aether Spire, Consulate blockades failed one by one.
Dispersal Technician.name: Dispersal Technician
Dispersal Technician.text: When Dispersal Technician enters the battlefield, you may return target artifact to its owner's hand.

Efficient Construction.flavor: For some of Ghirapur's aerowrights, building thopters is a byproduct of larger construction efforts.
Efficient Construction.name: Efficient Construction
Efficient Construction.text: Whenever you cast an artifact spell, create a 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature token with flying.

Hinterland Drake.flavor: "As a kid, I dreamed of flying on those wild drakes. They inspired me to build wings of my own." —Nadja Cloudtoucher, aerowright
Hinterland Drake.name: Hinterland Drake
Hinterland Drake.text:
Flying
Hinterland Drake can't block artifact creatures.

Ice Over.flavor: "Slow the Consulate with whatever you've got!" —Jasi Ganin, master siphoner
Ice Over.name: Ice Over
Ice Over.text:
Enchant artifact or creature
Enchanted permanent doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

Illusionist's Stratagem.flavor: "When everything hangs on a single moment, be sure you choose the right moment." —Jace Beleren
Illusionist's Stratagem.name: Illusionist's Stratagem
Illusionist's Stratagem.text:
Exile up to two target creatures you control, then return those cards to the battlefield under their owner's control.
Draw a card.

Leave in the Dust.flavor: The daredevil racers of the Derby Crows, long at odds with the Consulate, were quick to join the renegades in open revolt.
Leave in the Dust.name: Leave in the Dust
Leave in the Dust.text:
Return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand.
Draw a card.

Mechanized Production.flavor: "Give me eight walkers, I'll give you the city." —Dovin Baan
Mechanized Production.name: Mechanized Production
Mechanized Production.text:
Enchant artifact you control
At the beginning of your upkeep, create a token that's a copy of enchanted artifact. Then if you control eight or more artifacts with the same name as one another, you win the game.

Metallic Rebuke.flavor: "Too little, too late. The machine is in motion." —Tezzeret
Metallic Rebuke.name: Metallic Rebuke
Metallic Rebuke.text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.

Negate.flavor: "It is fascinating to see how the people of this plane replicate magical techniques without a natural gift. Also frustrating." —Jace Beleren
Negate.name: Negate

Quicksmith Spy.name: Quicksmith Spy
Quicksmith Spy.text: When Quicksmith Spy enters the battlefield, target artifact you control gains "{T}: Draw a card" for as long as you control Quicksmith Spy.

Reverse Engineer.flavor: The Hold, an illegal research facility in a derelict merchant ship, became a wellspring of renegade intelligence.
Reverse Engineer.name: Reverse Engineer
Reverse Engineer.text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Draw three cards.

Salvage Scuttler.flavor: A hermit crab goes through many shells in its lifetime, and not all are natural in origin.
Salvage Scuttler.name: Salvage Scuttler
Salvage Scuttler.text: Whenever Salvage Scuttler attacks, return an artifact you control to its owner's hand.

Shielded Aether Thief.name: Shielded Aether Thief
Shielded Aether Thief.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Whenever Shielded Aether Thief blocks, you get {E} (an energy counter).
{T}, Pay {E}{E}{E}: Draw a card.

Shipwreck Moray.flavor: Shipwrecks do wonders for the local fauna, providing both shelter and aether.
Shipwreck Moray.name: Shipwreck Moray
Shipwreck Moray.text:
When Shipwreck Moray enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E}{E}{E} (four energy counters).
Pay {E}: Shipwreck Moray gets +2/-2 until end of turn.

Skyship Plunderer.name: Skyship Plunderer
Skyship Plunderer.text:
Flying
Whenever Skyship Plunderer deals combat damage to a player, for each kind of counter on target permanent or player, give that permanent or player another counter of that kind.

Take into Custody.flavor: "You can tell me what I want to know, or you can talk to the Chief of Compliance. Why don't you make it easy on yourself?"
Take into Custody.name: Take into Custody
Take into Custody.text: Tap target creature. It doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

Trophy Mage.flavor: "The tools of the past will help us forge the future."
Trophy Mage.name: Trophy Mage
Trophy Mage.text: When Trophy Mage enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an artifact card with converted mana cost 3, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

Whir of Invention.name: Whir of Invention
Whir of Invention.text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Search your library for an artifact card with converted mana cost X or less, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.

Wind-Kin Raiders.flavor: Small aeronaut societies like the Wind-Kin had little to lose by siding with the renegades, and much to gain.
Wind-Kin Raiders.name: Wind-Kin Raiders
Wind-Kin Raiders.text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Flying

Aether Poisoner.name: Aether Poisoner
Aether Poisoner.text:
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
When Aether Poisoner enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Whenever Aether Poisoner attacks, you may pay {E}{E}. If you do, create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.

Alley Strangler.flavor: "You never know what day might be your last."
Alley Strangler.name: Alley Strangler

Battle at the Bridge.flavor: "This is bigger than you. All of you." —Tezzeret
Battle at the Bridge.name: Battle at the Bridge
Battle at the Bridge.text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn. You gain X life.

Cruel Finality.flavor: Bitter the bite of a demon's steel, and deep the abyss it opens.
Cruel Finality.name: Cruel Finality
Cruel Finality.text: Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn. Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

Daring Demolition.flavor: Living so close to death gives the aetherborn an unusual perspective on risk.
Daring Demolition.name: Daring Demolition

Defiant Salvager.flavor: "I didn't survive that crash just so I could fall to the likes of you."
Defiant Salvager.name: Defiant Salvager
Defiant Salvager.text: Sacrifice an artifact or creature: Put a +1/+1 counter on Defiant Salvager. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

Fatal Push.name: Fatal Push
Fatal Push.text:
Destroy target creature if it has converted mana cost 2 or less.
Revolt — Destroy that creature if it has converted mana cost 4 or less instead if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn.

Fen Hauler.flavor: "Success is found where others fear to look." —Ara, renegade smuggler
Fen Hauler.name: Fen Hauler
Fen Hauler.text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Fen Hauler can't be blocked by artifact creatures.

Foundry Hornet.flavor: Its buzzing is easily mistaken for the hum of a thopter's wings.
Foundry Hornet.name: Foundry Hornet
Foundry Hornet.text:
Flying
When Foundry Hornet enters the battlefield, if you control a creature with a +1/+1 counter on it, creatures your opponents control get -1/-1 until end of turn.

Fourth Bridge Prowler.flavor: Renegades run the gamut from lofty sages to petty thieves.
Fourth Bridge Prowler.name: Fourth Bridge Prowler
Fourth Bridge Prowler.text: When Fourth Bridge Prowler enters the battlefield, you may have target creature get -1/-1 until end of turn.

Gifted Aetherborn.flavor: A few aetherborn have discovered a way to sustain their own existences at the cost of an insatiable hunger for the life essence of other beings.
Gifted Aetherborn.name: Gifted Aetherborn

Glint-Sleeve Siphoner.name: Glint-Sleeve Siphoner
Glint-Sleeve Siphoner.text:
Menace
Whenever Glint-Sleeve Siphoner enters the battlefield or attacks, you get {E} (an energy counter).
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {E}{E}. If you do, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.

Gonti's Machinations.flavor: "I am confident that all our enterprises can benefit from this little revolution."
Gonti's Machinations.name: Gonti's Machinations
Gonti's Machinations.text:
Whenever you lose life for the first time each turn, you get {E}. (You get an energy counter. Damage causes loss of life.)
Pay {E}{E}, Sacrifice Gonti's Machinations: Each opponent loses 3 life. You gain life equal to the life lost this way.

Herald of Anguish.name: Herald of Anguish
Herald of Anguish.text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Flying
At the beginning of your end step, each opponent discards a card.
{1}{B}, Sacrifice an artifact: Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.

Ironclad Revolutionary.flavor: As the rebellion spread, renegade ingenuity outpaced the Consulate's greatest fears.
Ironclad Revolutionary.name: Ironclad Revolutionary
Ironclad Revolutionary.text: When Ironclad Revolutionary enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice an artifact. If you do, put two +1/+1 counters on Ironclad Revolutionary and each opponent loses 2 life.

Midnight Entourage.name: Midnight Entourage
Midnight Entourage.text:
Other Aetherborn you control get +1/+1.
Whenever Midnight Entourage or another Aetherborn you control dies, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.

Night Market Aeronaut.flavor: "Death might come tomorrow, but today—today I am alive."
Night Market Aeronaut.name: Night Market Aeronaut
Night Market Aeronaut.text:
Flying
Revolt — Night Market Aeronaut enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn.

Perilous Predicament.flavor: Comrades in life. Comrades in death.
Perilous Predicament.name: Perilous Predicament
Perilous Predicament.text: Each opponent sacrifices an artifact creature and a nonartifact creature.

Renegade's Getaway.flavor: You can't fight what you can't find.
Renegade's Getaway.name: Renegade's Getaway
Renegade's Getaway.text: Target permanent gains indestructible until end of turn. Create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token. (Effects that say "destroy" don't destroy a permanent with indestructible, and if it's a creature, it can't be destroyed by damage.)

Resourceful Return.flavor: When the salvage team brought in the shattered gearhulk, a wave of excitement swept through the renegade foundry.
Resourceful Return.name: Resourceful Return
Resourceful Return.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand. If you control an artifact, draw a card.

Secret Salvage.flavor: There is no shortage of illegal salvage in Ghirapur, nor of those who are willing to profit from it.
Secret Salvage.name: Secret Salvage
Secret Salvage.text: Exile target nonland card from your graveyard. Search your library for any number of cards with the same name as that card, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

Sly Requisitioner.name: Sly Requisitioner
Sly Requisitioner.text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Whenever a nontoken artifact you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.

Vengeful Rebel.flavor: Some aetherborn joined the rebellion for profit, others for the sake of their freedom, still others for revenge.
Vengeful Rebel.name: Vengeful Rebel
Vengeful Rebel.text: Revolt — When Vengeful Rebel enters the battlefield, if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, target creature an opponent controls gets -3/-3 until end of turn.

Yahenni, Undying Partisan.flavor: "The time for subtlety is over, darling."
Yahenni, Undying Partisan.name: Yahenni, Undying Partisan
Yahenni, Undying Partisan.text:
Haste
Whenever a creature an opponent controls dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Yahenni, Undying Partisan.
Sacrifice another creature: Yahenni gains indestructible until end of turn.

Yahenni's Expertise.flavor: "The Consulate pushed me to my limit, darling, and this is the result."
Yahenni's Expertise.name: Yahenni's Expertise
Yahenni's Expertise.text:
All creatures get -3/-3 until end of turn.
You may cast a card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your hand without paying its mana cost.

Aether Chaser.name: Aether Chaser
Aether Chaser.text:
First strike
When Aether Chaser enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Whenever Aether Chaser attacks, you may pay {E}{E}. If you do, create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.

Chandra's Revolution.flavor: Chandra was driven by her anger, directed particularly at the man who had taken her father from her.
Chandra's Revolution.name: Chandra's Revolution
Chandra's Revolution.text: Chandra's Revolution deals 4 damage to target creature. Tap target land. That land doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

Destructive Tampering.flavor: "I don't think they'll appreciate my . . . adjustments." —Karavin, renegade saboteur
Destructive Tampering.name: Destructive Tampering
Destructive Tampering.text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target artifact.
• Creatures without flying can't block this turn.

Embraal Gear-Smasher.flavor: "A well-made wrench is a versatile, indispensable tool."
Embraal Gear-Smasher.name: Embraal Gear-Smasher
Embraal Gear-Smasher.text: {T}, Sacrifice an artifact: Embraal Gear-Smasher deals 2 damage to each opponent.

Enraged Giant.flavor: When fighting spilled over into Giant's Walk, the aether weapons and swooping airships angered the normally placid creatures.
Enraged Giant.name: Enraged Giant
Enraged Giant.text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Trample, haste

Freejam Regent.flavor: The dragons perching in Freejam's towers symbolize the zone's fierce independence.
Freejam Regent.name: Freejam Regent
Freejam Regent.text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Flying
{1}{R}: Freejam Regent gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

Frontline Rebel.flavor: "Will you be strong and stand with me?"
Frontline Rebel.name: Frontline Rebel
Frontline Rebel.text: Frontline Rebel attacks each combat if able.

Gremlin Infestation.name: Gremlin Infestation
Gremlin Infestation.text:
Enchant artifact
At the beginning of your end step, Gremlin Infestation deals 2 damage to enchanted artifact's controller.
When enchanted artifact is put into a graveyard, create a 2/2 red Gremlin creature token.

Hungry Flames.flavor: In the hold of the Heart of Kiran, Chandra answered Dovin Baan's sabotage with an explosive retort.
Hungry Flames.name: Hungry Flames
Hungry Flames.text: Hungry Flames deals 3 damage to target creature and 2 damage to target player or planeswalker.

Indomitable Creativity.name: Indomitable Creativity
Indomitable Creativity.text: Destroy X target artifacts and/or creatures. For each permanent destroyed this way, its controller reveals cards from the top of their library until an artifact or creature card is revealed and exiles that card. Those players put the exiled cards onto the battlefield, then shuffle their libraries.

Invigorated Rampage.flavor: Gremlins can change from pest to problem to plague in the span of a moment.
Invigorated Rampage.name: Invigorated Rampage
Invigorated Rampage.text:
Choose one —
• Target creature gets +4/+0 and gains trample until end of turn.
• Two target creatures each get +2/+0 and gain trample until end of turn.

Kari Zev, Skyship Raider.flavor: Aboard her ship, the Dragon's Smile, Kari follows no one's rules but her own.
Kari Zev, Skyship Raider.name: Kari Zev, Skyship Raider
Kari Zev, Skyship Raider.text:
First strike, menace
Whenever Kari Zev, Skyship Raider attacks, create a legendary 2/1 red Monkey creature token named Ragavan that's tapped and attacking. Exile that token at end of combat.

Kari Zev's Expertise.name: Kari Zev's Expertise
Kari Zev's Expertise.text:
Gain control of target creature or Vehicle until end of turn. Untap it. It gains haste until end of turn.
You may cast a card with converted mana cost 2 or less from your hand without paying its mana cost.

Lathnu Sailback.flavor: Travelers to Lathnu, high on the Devra Cliffs, need not fear the political strife of Ghirapur . . . but they have other dangers to worry about.
Lathnu Sailback.name: Lathnu Sailback

Lightning Runner.name: Lightning Runner
Lightning Runner.text:
Double strike, haste
Whenever Lightning Runner attacks, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters), then you may pay {E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E}. If you pay, untap all creatures you control, and after this phase, there is an additional combat phase.

Pia's Revolution.flavor: Pia's passion was directed at the big picture—at making real, lasting change.
Pia's Revolution.name: Pia's Revolution
Pia's Revolution.text: Whenever a nontoken artifact is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, return that card to your hand unless target opponent has Pia's Revolution deal 3 damage to them.

Precise Strike.flavor: "Hit where it hurts, and always hit first."
Precise Strike.name: Precise Strike
Precise Strike.text: Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.

Quicksmith Rebel.flavor: "Let's add just a bit more stopping power."
Quicksmith Rebel.name: Quicksmith Rebel
Quicksmith Rebel.text: When Quicksmith Rebel enters the battlefield, target artifact you control gains "{T}: This artifact deals 2 damage to any target" for as long as you control Quicksmith Rebel.

Ravenous Intruder.flavor: "I've made some fine acquisitions of late, so I'm planning to make commensurate improvements to my security systems. I have a consultant coming tomorrow." —Kurna Majan, Luminary League
Ravenous Intruder.name: Ravenous Intruder
Ravenous Intruder.text: Sacrifice an artifact: Ravenous Intruder gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

Reckless Racer.flavor: Illegal street races turned out to be perfect practice for avoiding Consulate patrols.
Reckless Racer.name: Reckless Racer
Reckless Racer.text:
First strike
Whenever Reckless Racer becomes tapped, you may discard a card. If you do, draw a card.

Release the Gremlins.flavor: "Being an inventor means knowing how to use the tools at hand to make something great—or to bring it down." —Pia Nalaar
Release the Gremlins.name: Release the Gremlins
Release the Gremlins.text: Destroy X target artifacts. Create X 2/2 red Gremlin creature tokens.

Scrapper Champion.name: Scrapper Champion
Scrapper Champion.text:
Double strike (This creature deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)
When Scrapper Champion enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Whenever Scrapper Champion attacks, you may pay {E}{E}. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

Shock.flavor: The tools of invention became the weapons of revolution.
Shock.name: Shock
Shock.text: Shock deals 2 damage to any target.

Siege Modification.flavor: Perfect for getting through to the consuls.
Siege Modification.name: Siege Modification
Siege Modification.text:
Enchant creature or Vehicle
As long as enchanted permanent is a Vehicle, it's a creature in addition to its other types.
Enchanted creature gets +3/+0 and has first strike.

Sweatworks Brawler.flavor: The residents of Embraal were never known for finesse, just for getting things done.
Sweatworks Brawler.name: Sweatworks Brawler
Sweatworks Brawler.text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Menace

Wrangle.flavor: Gremlins are loyal to nothing but their next meal.
Wrangle.name: Wrangle
Wrangle.text: Gain control of target creature with power 4 or less until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn.

Aether Herder.name: Aether Herder
Aether Herder.text:
When Aether Herder enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Whenever Aether Herder attacks, you may pay {E}{E}. If you do, create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.

Aetherstream Leopard.name: Aetherstream Leopard
Aetherstream Leopard.text:
Trample
When Aetherstream Leopard enters the battlefield, you get {E} (an energy counter).
Whenever Aetherstream Leopard attacks, you may pay {E}. If you do, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

Aetherwind Basker.flavor: Its frill inspired the design of efficient aether collectors.
Aetherwind Basker.name: Aetherwind Basker
Aetherwind Basker.text:
Trample
Whenever Aetherwind Basker enters the battlefield or attacks, you get {E} (an energy counter) for each creature you control.
Pay {E}: Aetherwind Basker gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

Aid from the Cowl.name: Aid from the Cowl
Aid from the Cowl.text: Revolt — At the beginning of your end step, if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a permanent card, you may put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, you may put it on the bottom of your library.

Druid of the Cowl.flavor: "The wild tangle of the Cowl provides sanctuary to life that watched the first buildings rise."
Druid of the Cowl.name: Druid of the Cowl

Greenbelt Rampager.flavor: Subtlety is not a necessary part of sabotage.
Greenbelt Rampager.name: Greenbelt Rampager
Greenbelt Rampager.text: When Greenbelt Rampager enters the battlefield, pay {E}{E} (two energy counters). If you can't, return Greenbelt Rampager to its owner's hand and you get {E}.

Greenwheel Liberator.flavor: "I will not rest until every vestige of the Consulate—every banner, flag, and standard—has fallen."
Greenwheel Liberator.name: Greenwheel Liberator
Greenwheel Liberator.text: Revolt — Greenwheel Liberator enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn.

Heroic Intervention.flavor: "Wherever the strong would harm the weak, I will be there." —Ajani Goldmane
Heroic Intervention.name: Heroic Intervention
Heroic Intervention.text: Permanents you control gain hexproof and indestructible until end of turn.

Hidden Herbalists.flavor: In the cellars beneath Narnam House, a strange and deadly garden grows.
Hidden Herbalists.name: Hidden Herbalists
Hidden Herbalists.text: Revolt — When Hidden Herbalists enters the battlefield, if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, add {G}{G}.

Highspire Infusion.flavor: "If nothing else, the Inventors' Fair taught us that we're only beginning to discover aether's true potential." —Kershan Danil, Highspire artisan
Highspire Infusion.name: Highspire Infusion
Highspire Infusion.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn. You get {E}{E} (two energy counters).

Lifecraft Awakening.flavor: "It was made, yes, but that does not mean it cannot grow."
Lifecraft Awakening.name: Lifecraft Awakening
Lifecraft Awakening.text: Put X +1/+1 counters on target artifact you control. If it isn't a creature or Vehicle, it becomes a 0/0 Construct artifact creature.

Lifecraft Cavalry.flavor: "I do not ask you to be tame. I only ask you to be true." —Rishkar, Peema renegade
Lifecraft Cavalry.name: Lifecraft Cavalry
Lifecraft Cavalry.text:
Trample
Revolt — Lifecraft Cavalry enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn.

Lifecrafter's Gift.flavor: The best engineers recognize when a problem has already been solved.
Lifecrafter's Gift.name: Lifecrafter's Gift
Lifecrafter's Gift.text: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature, then put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it.

Maulfist Revolutionary.name: Maulfist Revolutionary
Maulfist Revolutionary.text:
Trample
When Maulfist Revolutionary enters the battlefield or dies, for each kind of counter on target permanent or player, give that permanent or player another counter of that kind.

Monstrous Onslaught.name: Monstrous Onslaught
Monstrous Onslaught.text: Monstrous Onslaught deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures, where X is the greatest power among creatures you control as you cast this spell.

Narnam Renegade.flavor: "I do not need to pierce your heart to still its beating."
Narnam Renegade.name: Narnam Renegade
Narnam Renegade.text:
Deathtouch
Revolt — Narnam Renegade enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn.

Natural Obsolescence.flavor: "It is folly to believe your precious inventions will endure. All things return to the soil." —Nirav, Tirahar elder
Natural Obsolescence.name: Natural Obsolescence
Natural Obsolescence.text: Put target artifact on the bottom of its owner's library.

Peema Aether-Seer.name: Peema Aether-Seer
Peema Aether-Seer.text:
When Peema Aether-Seer enters the battlefield, you get an amount of {E} (energy counters) equal to the greatest power among creatures you control.
Pay {E}{E}{E}: Target creature blocks this turn if able.

Prey Upon.flavor: It is the nature of the strong to survive.
Prey Upon.name: Prey Upon
Prey Upon.text: Target creature you control fights target creature you don't control. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

Ridgescale Tusker.flavor: "Each creature holds a solution to a problem, a lesson to be learned." —Oviya Pashiri, sage lifecrafter
Ridgescale Tusker.name: Ridgescale Tusker
Ridgescale Tusker.text: When Ridgescale Tusker enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on each other creature you control.

Rishkar, Peema Renegade.flavor: "Aether is the soul of Kaladesh, and all souls should be free."
Rishkar, Peema Renegade.name: Rishkar, Peema Renegade
Rishkar, Peema Renegade.text:
When Rishkar, Peema Renegade enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to two target creatures.
Each creature you control with a counter on it has "{T}: Add {G}."

Rishkar's Expertise.flavor: "Control the Great Conduit? You might as well try to divert a river with your hands."
Rishkar's Expertise.name: Rishkar's Expertise
Rishkar's Expertise.text:
Draw cards equal to the greatest power among creatures you control.
You may cast a card with converted mana cost 5 or less from your hand without paying its mana cost.

Scrounging Bandar.flavor: "It was right here a second ago . . ."
Scrounging Bandar.name: Scrounging Bandar
Scrounging Bandar.text:
Scrounging Bandar enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may move any number of +1/+1 counters from Scrounging Bandar onto another target creature.

Silkweaver Elite.flavor: Elvish weavers use spidersilk to make everything from tapestries to rappelling ropes.
Silkweaver Elite.name: Silkweaver Elite
Silkweaver Elite.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Revolt — When Silkweaver Elite enters the battlefield, if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, draw a card.

Unbridled Growth.flavor: "If the Consulate has abandoned restraint, so too shall the wilds." —Surash, keeper of the Cowl
Unbridled Growth.name: Unbridled Growth
Unbridled Growth.text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}: Add one mana of any color."
Sacrifice Unbridled Growth: Draw a card.

Ajani Unyielding.name: Ajani Unyielding
Ajani Unyielding.text:
+2: Reveal the top three cards of your library. Put all nonland permanent cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
−2: Exile target creature. Its controller gains life equal to its power.
−9: Put five +1/+1 counters on each creature you control and five loyalty counters on each other planeswalker you control.

Dark Intimations.name: Dark Intimations
Dark Intimations.text:
Each opponent sacrifices a creature or planeswalker, then discards a card. You return a creature or planeswalker card from your graveyard to your hand, then draw a card.
When you cast a Bolas planeswalker spell, exile Dark Intimations from your graveyard. That planeswalker enters the battlefield with an additional loyalty counter on it.

Hidden Stockpile.name: Hidden Stockpile
Hidden Stockpile.text:
Revolt — At the beginning of your end step, if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.
{1}, Sacrifice a creature: Scry 1.

Maverick Thopterist.text:

Oath of Ajani.flavor: "Until all have found their place, I will keep watch."
Oath of Ajani.name: Oath of Ajani
Oath of Ajani.text:
When Oath of Ajani enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.
Planeswalker spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

Outland Boar.flavor: The vibrant forest of Peema is awash with aether. Its animals are stronger, faster, and more aggressive than their counterparts elsewhere.
Outland Boar.name: Outland Boar
Outland Boar.text: Outland Boar can't be blocked by creatures with power 2 or less.

Renegade Rallier.name: Renegade Rallier
Renegade Rallier.text: Revolt — When Renegade Rallier enters the battlefield, if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, return target permanent card with converted mana cost 2 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.

Renegade Wheelsmith.flavor: Many veterans of the Ovalchase racetrack turned their talents to the renegade cause.
Renegade Wheelsmith.name: Renegade Wheelsmith
Renegade Wheelsmith.text: Whenever Renegade Wheelsmith becomes tapped, target creature can't block this turn.

Rogue Refiner.flavor: "It's natural, it's all around us, and it's there for the taking. Just try and tell me what I'm doing is wrong."
Rogue Refiner.name: Rogue Refiner
Rogue Refiner.text: When Rogue Refiner enters the battlefield, draw a card and you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).

Spire Patrol.flavor: "After I examine your cargo and check your papers, you can be on your way."
Spire Patrol.name: Spire Patrol
Spire Patrol.text:
Flying
When Spire Patrol enters the battlefield, tap target creature an opponent controls. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

+1: Create a colorless artifact token named Etherium Cell with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color."
−2: Target creature gets +X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of artifacts you control.

Tezzeret's Touch.name: Tezzeret's Touch
Tezzeret's Touch.text:
Enchant artifact
Enchanted artifact is a creature with base power and toughness 5/5 in addition to its other types.
When enchanted artifact is put into a graveyard, return that card to its owner's hand.

Weldfast Engineer.flavor: "Let's err on the side of glorious mayhem."
Weldfast Engineer.name: Weldfast Engineer
Weldfast Engineer.text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, target artifact creature you control gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

Winding Constrictor.name: Winding Constrictor
Winding Constrictor.text:
If one or more counters would be put on an artifact or creature you control, that many plus one of each of those kinds of counters are put on that permanent instead.
If you would get one or more counters, you get that many plus one of each of those kinds of counters instead.

Aegis Automaton.flavor: The streets of Ghirapur have become dangerous. It's good to have a dependable companion.
Aegis Automaton.name: Aegis Automaton
Aegis Automaton.text: {4}{W}: Return another target creature you control to its owner's hand.

Flying

Augmenting Automaton.name: Augmenting Automaton
Augmenting Automaton.text: {1}{B}: Augmenting Automaton gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

Barricade Breaker.flavor: "The Consulate sought to crush us. Let's give them a taste of their own medicine." —Venkat Dasai, renegade commander

Barricade Breaker.text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)

Consulate Dreadnought.flavor: "It's like they planted another Bastion right in the middle of the harbor." —Bes Tavani, Bomat merchant

{T}: You get {E} (an energy counter).

Crackdown Construct.flavor: "All buildings are subject to search. Resistance will be punished." —Enforcer-Chief Ranaj
Crackdown Construct.name: Crackdown Construct

Daredevil Dragster.name: Daredevil Dragster
Daredevil Dragster.text:
At end of combat, if Daredevil Dragster attacked or blocked this combat, put a velocity counter on it. Then if it has two or more velocity counters on it, sacrifice it and draw two cards.
Crew 2 (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 2 or more: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)

Filigree Crawler.flavor: "The most harmonious designs are based on relationships found in nature." —Venand Kapur, the Gearherder
Filigree Crawler.name: Filigree Crawler
Filigree Crawler.text: When Filigree Crawler dies, create a 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature token with flying.

Foundry Assembler.flavor: "They never tire, they never complain, and they never ask questions. Build more." —Ivash, Consulate inventor

Foundry Assembler.text: Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)

Gonti's Aether Heart.flavor: Despite the magic that sustains Gonti's life, the crime lord is often described as heartless.
Gonti's Aether Heart.name: Gonti's Aether Heart
Gonti's Aether Heart.text:
Whenever Gonti's Aether Heart or another artifact enters the battlefield under your control, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Pay {E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E}, Exile Gonti's Aether Heart: Take an extra turn after this one.

Heart of Kiran.name: Heart of Kiran
Heart of Kiran.text:
Flying, vigilance
Crew 3 (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 3 or more: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)
You may remove a loyalty counter from a planeswalker you control rather than pay Heart of Kiran's crew cost.

Hope of Ghirapur.flavor: The renegades mounted an aether disruptor aboard a lightweight thopter to destroy Tezzeret's Planar Bridge.

Hope of Ghirapur.text:
Flying
Sacrifice Hope of Ghirapur: Until your next turn, target player who was dealt combat damage by Hope of Ghirapur this turn can't cast noncreature spells.

Implement of Combustion.flavor: A dream of fire lies coiled inside, waiting for its glorious awakening.
Implement of Combustion.name: Implement of Combustion
Implement of Combustion.text:
{R}, Sacrifice Implement of Combustion: It deals 1 damage to target player or planeswalker.
When Implement of Combustion is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, draw a card.

Implement of Examination.flavor: A tool to see the unseen.
Implement of Examination.name: Implement of Examination
Implement of Examination.text:
{U}, Sacrifice Implement of Examination: Draw a card.
When Implement of Examination is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, draw a card.

Implement of Ferocity.text:
{G}, Sacrifice Implement of Ferocity: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
When Implement of Ferocity is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, draw a card.

Implement of Improvement.name: Implement of Improvement
Implement of Improvement.text:
{W}, Sacrifice Implement of Improvement: You gain 2 life.
When Implement of Improvement is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, draw a card.

{B}, Sacrifice Implement of Malice: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
When Implement of Malice is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, draw a card.

Inspiring Statuary.flavor: Ghirapur's most celebrated inventors have been immortalized in clockwork.
Inspiring Statuary.name: Inspiring Statuary
Inspiring Statuary.text: Nonartifact spells you cast have improvise. (Your artifacts can help cast those spells. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)

Irontread Crusher.text: Crew 3 (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 3 or more: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)

Lifecrafter's Bestiary.flavor: "Inspiration is found by looking outward." —Oviya Pashiri, sage lifecrafter
Lifecrafter's Bestiary.name: Lifecrafter's Bestiary
Lifecrafter's Bestiary.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, scry 1.
Whenever you cast a creature spell, you may pay {G}. If you do, draw a card.

Merchant's Dockhand.flavor: "If you can build it, we can move it." —Bes Tavani, Bomat merchant
Merchant's Dockhand.name: Merchant's Dockhand
Merchant's Dockhand.text: {3}{U}, {T}, Tap X untapped artifacts you control: Look at the top X cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

Metallic Mimic.name: Metallic Mimic
Metallic Mimic.text:
As Metallic Mimic enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
Metallic Mimic is the chosen type in addition to its other types.
Each other creature you control of the chosen type enters the battlefield with an additional +1/+1 counter on it.

Mobile Garrison.name: Mobile Garrison
Mobile Garrison.text:
Whenever Mobile Garrison attacks, untap another target artifact or creature you control.
Crew 2 (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 2 or more: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)

Night Market Guard.flavor: "One head watches for Consulate enforcers. The other watches for renegade thieves." —Crime Lord Gonti
Night Market Guard.name: Night Market Guard
Night Market Guard.text: Night Market Guard can block an additional creature each combat.

Ornithopter.flavor: "You want to know what we are fighting for? Look at the wonder in that child's eyes." —Pia Nalaar
Ornithopter.name: Ornithopter

Pacification Array.flavor: The Consulate had access to thousands of innovative devices displayed at the Inventors' Fair. A few small changes transformed some of them from marvels of ingenuity to instruments of oppression.
Pacification Array.name: Pacification Array

Paradox Engine.flavor: "One look at this glorious item convinced me that Kaladesh deserved my full attention. Sure enough, my time here has yielded exquisite fruit." —Tezzeret
Paradox Engine.name: Paradox Engine
Paradox Engine.text: Whenever you cast a spell, untap all nonland permanents you control.

Peacewalker Colossus.flavor: "Peace? Its sole purpose is fear." —Saheeli Rai
Peacewalker Colossus.name: Peacewalker Colossus
Peacewalker Colossus.text:
{1}{W}: Another target Vehicle you control becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.
Crew 4 (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 4 or more: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)

Planar Bridge.flavor: "It is finished. Now the real work can begin." —Tezzeret
Planar Bridge.name: Planar Bridge
Planar Bridge.text: {8}, {T}: Search your library for a permanent card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.

Prizefighter Construct.flavor: The Scrappers, an underground group with a passion for automaton brawls, had renegade leanings even before the Consulate's crackdown. It didn't take long for them to lend their best brawlers to the conflict.
Prizefighter Construct.name: Prizefighter Construct

Renegade Map.flavor: "We have safe houses in every zone, but you'll never find one without this."
Renegade Map.name: Renegade Map
Renegade Map.text:
Renegade Map enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}, Sacrifice Renegade Map: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

Reservoir Walker.flavor: Renegade supply lines are, by necessity, mobile and difficult to disrupt.
Reservoir Walker.name: Reservoir Walker
Reservoir Walker.text: When Reservoir Walker enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life and get {E}{E}{E} (three energy counters).

Scrap Trawler.name: Scrap Trawler
Scrap Trawler.text: Whenever Scrap Trawler or another artifact you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return to your hand target artifact card in your graveyard with lesser converted mana cost.

Servo Schematic.flavor: The Consulate prizes innovation when it is dependable and replicable.
Servo Schematic.name: Servo Schematic
Servo Schematic.text: When Servo Schematic enters the battlefield or is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.

Treasure Keeper.name: Treasure Keeper
Treasure Keeper.text: When Treasure Keeper dies, reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a nonland card with converted mana cost 3 or less. You may cast that card without paying its mana cost. Put all revealed cards not cast this way on the bottom of your library in a random order.

Universal Solvent.flavor: "A few drops of this, and the trickiest problems simply melt away." —Thamaz, Weldfast inventor
Universal Solvent.name: Universal Solvent
Universal Solvent.text: {7}, {T}, Sacrifice Universal Solvent: Destroy target permanent.

Untethered Express.flavor: Rules and rails are made to be broken.
Untethered Express.name: Untethered Express
Untethered Express.text:
Trample

Crew 1 (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 1 or more: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)

Verdant Automaton.flavor: "A perfect fusion of nature and artifice." —Irsi, Kujar gardener

Watchful Automaton.flavor: "Before we can destroy our enemies, we must find them. We must peer into every wretched hovel and every teeming market." —Baral, Chief of Compliance
Watchful Automaton.name: Watchful Automaton
Watchful Automaton.text: {2}{U}: Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

Welder Automaton.flavor: Most of the constructs the renegades used against the Consulate weren't originally intended for combat. But some didn't require much modification.
Welder Automaton.name: Welder Automaton
Welder Automaton.text: {3}{R}: Welder Automaton deals 1 damage to each opponent.

Spire of Industry.flavor: A beacon of prosperity to some, a shadow of oppression to others.

Spire of Industry.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}, Pay 1 life: Add one mana of any color. Activate this ability only if you control an artifact.

Ajani, Valiant Protector.text:
+2: Put two +1/+1 counters on up to one target creature.
+1: Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a creature card. Put that card into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.
−11: Put X +1/+1 counters on target creature, where X is your life total. That creature gains trample until end of turn.

Inspiring Roar.flavor: "This is about more than aether or inventions. Tezzeret's schemes must be stopped!" —Ajani Goldmane
Inspiring Roar.name: Inspiring Roar
Inspiring Roar.text: Put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.

Ajani's Comrade.flavor: "I will go where the lion-man leads."

Ajani's Comrade.text:
Trample

Ajani's Aid.text:
When Ajani's Aid enters the battlefield, you may search your library and/or graveyard for a card named Ajani, Valiant Protector, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you search your library this way, shuffle it.
Sacrifice Ajani's Aid: Prevent all combat damage a creature of your choice would deal this turn.

Tranquil Expanse.flavor: Beyond the chaos of Ghirapur lies a vibrant world where aether flows through nature.
Tranquil Expanse.name: Tranquil Expanse
Tranquil Expanse.text:
Tranquil Expanse enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} or {W}.

Tezzeret, Master of Metal.name: Tezzeret, Master of Metal
Tezzeret, Master of Metal.text:
+1: Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal an artifact card. Put that card into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.

Tezzeret's Betrayal.flavor: "You can't hope to comprehend the plans that are in motion." —Tezzeret
Tezzeret's Betrayal.name: Tezzeret's Betrayal
Tezzeret's Betrayal.text: Destroy target creature. You may search your library and/or graveyard for a card named Tezzeret, Master of Metal, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you search your library this way, shuffle it.

Pendulum of Patterns.flavor: Its elaborate designs reveal secrets of aether's flow.
Pendulum of Patterns.name: Pendulum of Patterns
Pendulum of Patterns.text:
When Pendulum of Patterns enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
{5}, {T}, Sacrifice Pendulum of Patterns: Draw a card.

Tezzeret's Simulacrum.flavor: Tezzeret's command of living metal has nothing to do with intricate gearcraft or aether supplies.
Tezzeret's Simulacrum.name: Tezzeret's Simulacrum
Tezzeret's Simulacrum.text: {T}: Target opponent loses 1 life. If you control a Tezzeret planeswalker, that player loses 3 life instead.

Submerged Boneyard.flavor: Aether currents in the sky mirror water currents below, including the deadly rapids.
Submerged Boneyard.name: Submerged Boneyard
Submerged Boneyard.text:
Submerged Boneyard enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U} or {B}.
